name: fuckyoufriday
text: When my new roomie asked me who was going to cook him dinner last night, I rejoined with "Samuel H. Invisible". He didn't understand.

name: hollis
text: Should you really be living with someone who doesn't understand Achewood references?

name: mat4900
text: That can be fixed, more to the point should he really be living with someone who expects him to cook for them?

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by _cheesekayke, farqussus, Dwilow, retinarow, apres, Eraia)

name: mustconcentrate
text: Dude, there are also people who just haven't been introduced to Achewood yet.

name: rowboat
text: Those are the worst kind of people! I mean seriously, what the fuck is wrong with them?

name: dusty
text: And for those who haven't heard of it, show them, and if they don't laugh and instead cease reading, shake the dust off your feet when you leave that home or town.

name: duperando
text: Nice biblical reference there.

name: deusoma
text: A comment left by deusoma was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aseidel, TheLoneliestMonkey, Doc_Rostov, apres)

name: machegav
text:
I just had a grim vision of the future wherein the entire education system is rooted in Achewood like a sacred text.

The Cure two minutes' hate

Ketel One in the water fountains

Vegans left to die of exposure at birth

name: rowboat
text: Grim?

name: carlyle
text: How would we know they are vegan

name: rowboat
text: Because they would dress like hobos even though they live with their parents.

name: greenkoolayd
text: at birth?

name: deusoma
text: Yes, that was the joke.

name: greenkoolayd
text: A comment left by greenkoolayd was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Mangtastic, logic, Appers)

name: machegav
text: Actually, that was the maybe-subtle little joke. Nature vs. nurture, &c.

name: giantants
text: Would love to hear a recording of this song, ideally as sung by someone with no voice traiing and mabe even kind of a scratchy throat.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Tom Waits?

name: giantants
text: Actually fuck yeah that's a good idea.  Onstad should maybe put some heat under that sucker.

name: jrpigman
text: In saying so, you are assuming that the mother isn't already turned out.

name: gormster
text: DiSaGrEeMeNt BoX

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh, this is where I got this phrase! I've been using it all over, and I just Google'd it because I was getting curious about where I'd first heard it, and I was lead here. How exciting.

name: hellofditties
text: How strange.  That is why I am here too.

name: gormster
text: It's from Ray's flowchart, in case you are wondering.

name: heccibiggs
text: I became aware of this at some point in the five months since I wrote that comment.

name: hellofditties
text: I was aware, but I wanted to know the PRECISE ARRANGEMENT OF THE LETTERS because I am Strange.

name: spinynorman
text: I could hear Tom crooning that while a pump organ atonally reels back and forth and a bassoon honks in the background.

name: rowboat
text: I can hear no one singing that but Mister Rogers, and I'm OK with that.

name: gournal
text:
Once upon a time, there was a poor child,
With no father and no mother,
And everything was dead,
And no one was left in the whole world.
The child went and searched day and night,
And since nobody was left on the earth,
He wanted to go up in to the heavens,
And the moon was looking at him so friendly,
And when he finally got to the moon,
The moon was a piece of rotten wood.
And when he wanted to go back down to Earth,
The Earth was an overturned piss-pot, And he was all alone.
And he sat down and he cried.
And he is there to this day.
All alone.

name: puguglypress
text: (taps foot, hums)

name: gumfish
text: Reading this before bed feels sort of weird and good. bedtime story success

name: tekende
text:
I...I can hear it in my head. It is SO GOOD, guys.

so good

name: twotonturkey
text: It plays in my head like the theme song to a bad early 90s sitcom.

name: deimosrising
text: When my close friends are not around I will frequently also forget to eat.

name: hollis
text:
That is why everyone should have a copy of the tapes Philippe's mom sent him:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=04192002

name: mattylite
text: I bet so!

name: ovenface
text: tonight my dinner was part of a little cake at 10:30 because i forgot to eat.

name: tekende
text: I have so many questions, but am unsure how to phrase them. I suppose I just wonder what qualifies a cake as "little," and if it is little, why did you only have part of it?

name: ovenface
text: If I eat the whole thing at once, I will either grow or shrink to drastic proportions. Since I don't know which will be the outcome, it's best to eat the cake in parts.

name: tekende
text: Your hair wants cutting.

name: belgand
text: When my girlfriend leave town I also will often forget to eat. Normally I just forget to sleep.

name: rowboat
text: Belgand has real human needs - pass it on.

name: tekende
text: belgand can't sleep without his girlfriend, pass it on

name: theguitarhero
text: belgand has human emotions, pass it on.

name: belgand
text: Belgand fails to notice most bodily urges unless conspicuously reminded. EOL

name: lizjones
text: Grelicious. Thank you, Mr. Onstad, for introducing another bewildering term into my vocabulary.

name: fuckalgebra
text: One wonders if it is merely a portmanteau of "great" and "delicious," or if it reflects something more specific, such as the quality of being very palatable after the person eating it has not realised to eat for a week.

name: professorhazard
text: I believe it is a combination of "gruffle" and "delicious".

name: utv
text: I dunno, I think of it less as a portmanteau and more just Beef's unique spin on the English language. See also: 'jilapidated.'

name: hellofyellin
text:
He's never taken me to the zoo/ And I've never seen a doctor... He's Samuel!

What's the tune to Samuel H. Invisible

name: catachresis
text: It is a generic children's TV theme, except with undertones of anger and a minor chord at the end.

name: hellofyellin
text: Tee hee.

name: sp1derbaby
text: D minor. It is the saddest chord.

name: hellofyellin
text: It's been known to make people weep instantly.

name: soticoto
text:
It has to end with a diminished 7th though.
It just won't work without a diminished 7th.

name: tekende
text: It sounds like every They Might Be Giants song

name: zapatos
text: They Might Be a Band You Buy an Album From.  Maybe.  Probably not though.

name: rowboat
text: I sure did.

name: tekende
text: I have bought several TMBG albums. I greatly enjoy their music.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I'm buying a TMBG album right now, and loving it!


I'm not really. I just wanted to get in on the whole customer-testimonial vibe going on here.

name: laserblade
text: The exact tune of "Road to Peace" by Tom Waits.

name: tekende
text: AKA "The Song That Never Ends"

name: ghostd
text: We can only hope and pray that Samuel has not suicided.

name: adhesion
text: I love how in panel 5 Ray is exasperated as if he has heard this a million times.

name: rotating-dog
text: I sing this whenever I'm asked to do things. I hadn't noticed how often I do it, but apparently enough to cause my family to react like Ray does.

name: qatipay
text: What IS Ray reading?

name: epicurus
text: Seconded

name: tekende
text: GQ. Or Cosmo.

name: purplehaze
text: How has he forgotten to eat? Wasn't he just now browning lamb for moussaka?

name: mat4900
text: Perhaps the moussaka was for Gramma K.

name: overmedicated
text: Moussaka is not good eats.

name: leftsaidtim
text: You sir are a liar and a cheat.

name: rowboat
text: Either you've never had moussaka or you're a vegetarian. Either way, you're not to be listened to.

name: someone3
text: good contunuity catch

name: tttt
text:
Beef cooks, finds himself unworthy of the finished product, and throws it away

by the way, 5 5 5 5 5

name: squi
text: Sure, he was browning lamb, but that's pretty early into the whole moussaka cooking ordeal. He took Weldon and his 1938 Enos Slaughter rookie card and straigt up walked out before the moussaka was done.

name: atmus
text: Yeah, then his cooking was interrupted and he forgot about it while yelling and moving out.  I bet that moussaka is REALLY brown now.

name: cousinted
text: The cat sings a song about his neglectfed childhood.

name: cousinted
text:
Neglectfed of course being a portmanteau of Neglect and fed. Not a typo, nosiree


(I think they're buying it)

name: zem
text: good work smiley bone

name: jyuu
text: An instance that showcases how little Ray sometimes seems to understand Beef and his childhood; if he realized how detrimental to Beef's self-esteem Gramma K's treatment of Beef throughout his life was, would he still be so worried about her?

name: nilehus
text:
I give this five because I have the same first name and middle initial as Samuel H. Invisible.

And I like how Beef says seven days rather then a week.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: I forgot to tell you about what happened at McDonald's!
Little Nephew: Uncle Ray got peen!

Hey, an early Leo Fontinette appearance in Ray's blog!

text: you can tell that Ray has memories of Beef's childhood with Samuel H. Invisible.

name: gussiejives
text: Freddie Fractions and Montmartre on the other hand stick with Beef.

text: i'd love a book about the circumstances beef is from

name: otterpops
text: Roast Beef's childhood was so miserable.

name: nice-on-water
text: I keep thinking Samuel L. Jackson's middle initial is H. because of this comic.

name: fermatprime
text: i am starting in on grant morrison's the invisibles right now and i can't help but think of samuel.

name: panamajack
text: "Interesting that Jesus Christ and Samuel Invisible share the same middle name. Perhaps this 'Samuel' is deeply rooted in the Judeo-Christian tradition of redepmption and salvation in the same way Jesus is, especially considering what's going on in Roast Beef's life right now." --Excerpt from my thesis, [i]Webcomic Wizardry: Magical Sex Blokes and Jesus[i/].

text: I hear the tune in my head, it is fmailiar but without name

text: I just realized something, everytime i scroll down one scroll-thing, i have to click. What the FUCK is wrong with me?
